name: Tamarind-Glazed Steak with Crispy Curried Chickpeas and Ginger Greens

steps.title: Marinate Steak

ingredients.name: ten ounce inside round steak
ingredients.description: Beef round is a large primal cut consisting of well-exercised muscles from the leg and rump of the animal.

ingredients.name: taramrind paste
ingredients.description: Tamarind paste is a common ingredient usually featured in the preparation of a myriad of delicacies around the world. The paste is prepared from tamarind â€“ a sticky sour tasting fruit that grows on bean-like pods on tamarind trees.

ingredients.name: soy sauce
ingredients.description: The sauce of a small soy.

ingredients.name: sesame oil
ingredients.description: The oil of a large sesame.

equipment.name: resealable plastic bag
equipment.description: A plastic bag with added technology for sealing and resealing.

steps.instructions: Preheat oven to four hundred and twenty five degrees fareinheit. Rinse steak and pat dry with paper towel, In a large resealable plastic bag, combine tamarind paste, soy sauce, agave, and half of the sesame oil. Add steak, turn to coat, and set aside to marinate for about ten minutes at room temperature.

vocabTerms.name: marinate
vocabTerms.description: To marin something before you ate it.

steps.title: Roast Chickpeas

ingredients.name: chickpeas
ingredients.description: Baby peas. Good for mashing, smashing, frying, and eating in just about all forms.

ingredients.name: one and a half tablespoons of olive oil
one quarter teaspoon of kosher salt

steps.instructions: While steak marinates, drain chickpeas and rinse. On a baking sheet, toss with curry powder, one and a half tablespoons olive oil, and one quarter teasponn of kosher salt. Arrange in a single layer. Transfer to oven, and roast until crisp. Fifteen to eighteen minutes.

steps.title: Saute Chinese Broccoli

ingredients.name: sesame oil
ingredients.description: The oil of a small sesame.

equipment.name: cutting board
equipment.description: A board to keep your knives off the counter.

equipment.name: medium pan
equipment.description: A cooking pan for cooking of a medium size.

equipment.name: Chinese broccoli knife
equipment.description: A knife specially designed for cutting Chinese broccoli.

steps.instructions: While chickpeas roast, rinse Chinese broccoli and cut crosswise into one inch pieces. Trim and discard skin of ginger and mince. Rinse spinach. Heat remaining sesame oil in a medium pan over medium heat. When oil is shimmering, add Chinese broccoli and ginger and saute, stirring occasionally, until softening, three to four minutes.

vocabTerms.name: saute
vocabTerms.description: A french word meaning, cook in a pan.

vocabTerms.name: mince
vocabTerms.description: To cut into very tiny pieces.
